welcome.title: Welcome to Derot My Brain
welcome.intro: The app that transforms your curiosity into active knowledge.

guide.title: Getting Started Guide
guide.purposeText: Stop doomscrolling and start learning. Derot uses your curiosity to help you learn actively from Wikipedia articles.
guide.feature1Text: Discover random Wikipedia articles or choose specific categories to satisfy your curiosity.
guide.feature2Text: Challenge yourself with AI-generated quizzes about the articles you just read.
guide.feature3Text: Keep track of your learning journey, scores, and best performances over time.
guide.feature4Text: Save interesting topics to your Focus Area to revisit them and master them through repetition.

limitations.title: Limitations & Prerequisites
limitations.description: This version of Derot My Brain requires a local LLM on your machine, but don't panic, it's extremely simple.

steps.intro: Here are the 3 steps to follow to fully use Derot My Brain if you don't know how to configure a local LLM accessible via API:
steps.step2: B) Download a model (we recommend llama3:8b which is available in the ollama list). To do this, expand the list in the ollama "chat zone" and click the download icon.
steps.step3: C) Open the AI settings (top right of Derot My Brain -> robot icon) then test the configuration.
steps.step3Note: If you chose a model other than llama3:8b in step 2, please indicate it in the corresponding field.

performance.description: Using an LLM can heavily impact user experience (your machine's power limits the LLM's capacity).
performance.example: For example, MCQ type Quizzes are less resource-intensive.
performance.important: We recommend allocating more context when you ask for "Open-Ended" type quizzes or when the Document is long.

images.description: Images are not yet supported by DerotMyBrain (our interaction with the LLM is purely text-based)
images.note: In reality this depends on the model used by the LLM. For simplicity, this is not yet supported.

step1.title: 1. Explore & Discover

step2.title: 2. Read Actively
step2.description: Take the time to read the article. This is the foundation of your learning.

step4.description: If you like a topic, add it to your 'Focus' to track your progress over time.
